file_content.text: You really must be the Republic's finest. I didn't think anyone had the strength to stand up to my children.
I'm a little tougher than the innocent civilians your rakghouls terrorized on Kaon.
I'm not some helpless victim.
You despise me, don't you? You think what I'm doing is monstrous. My assistants felt the same way.
The power of the light side is far greater than anything you've created.
The Force sustained me.
You underestimate me, my good Jedi. I had the same problem with my assistants.
I've faced enemies of every kind, shape and number. They all go down if you shoot them enough times.
I've had a lot of practice.
Fighting your pets was easier than bribing a Neimoidian customs official.
Actually, it was easy.
You mock what you do not understand. I had the same problem with my assistants.
Your children are nothing but savage, mindless beasts!
They're monsters!
Your prejudices are blinding you to the glory of what I have created. My assistants felt the same way.
I heard the logs. Doctor Ingrol was going to try and stop you. What did you do to him?
Where are your assistants?
My assistants did not appreciate the value of my research. They sabotaged my files and tried to destroy my lab.
Their loyalty is no longer in question, however. Not since they were exposed to the virus.
Ending their existence will be a mercy.
A fate worse than death.
I doubt they would agree. They are not victims. I have made them into something greater!
You really think they'll stay loyal after you turned them into monsters?
They'll turn on you.
I'm not a fool. Absolute loyalty to their creator is one of the by-products of the transformation.
I've already taken out about a hundred of your "children." What's a few more?
So I'll kill them, too.
The rakghouls you faced as you ravaged my lab were nothing compared to these!
I've found a way to evolve the virus. Each new strain makes the host more powerful than the last.
I can make you understand, if you let me. Join my army. Be transformed into something greater than you are!
I would, but I think it probably violates the Jedi Code.
Uh... I'll pass.
You really got to work on your sales pitch, doc.
Uh... I'll pass.
You have no idea what you're giving up. I've finally developed the perfect strain of the rakghoul virus.
You're not thinking clearly. Surrender and I'll see you get proper medical help.
You're sick. You need help.
I have no need of your medical droids. Not anymore. I've finally developed the perfect strain of the rakghoul virus.
I'm tired of listening to your insane ranting.
My patience is wearing thin.
Insane is a label used by those who lack vision. Don't you understand? I've finally developed the perfect strain of the rakghoul virus!
All the benefits, none of the drawbacks! The subject is transformed physically, but the mental faculties remain untouched!
I injected myself just before you entered. It should be taking effect right... about... now!
Ahh!
Witness the future of the galaxy! Behold the pinnacle of evolution before you die!
Butchers! Trespassers! How dare you come into my lab and slaughter my children!
I've killed more Jedi and Sith than I can remember. A few rakghouls aren't going to slow me down.
It really wasn't that hard.
Are you angry that I killed them, or that they were too weak to stop me?
I doubt you regret their loss.
Typical. Why are the Sith all so arrogant? Do you really think you know better than me?
I was paid to take you down. They got in the way.
Just doing my job.
Loyalty to the highest bidder. I wonder how long until you betray your Imperial masters?
Maybe you should spend less time in the lab, and more time teaching your kids how to fight.
It really wasn't that hard.
Now I understand. You mock and destroy what you fear.
Your children are mindless brutes unfit to live.
They deserve death.
I wouldn't expect the Empire to understand. Your prejudice blinds you to the glory of my creations!
I had the same problem with my assistants. They sabotaged my files. Tried to destroy my lab.
You've created an incredible weapon. One we plan to take from you.
The Empire wants the virus.
Ha! Fortunately, I no longer have to worry about my research falling into the Empire's hands. My assistants sabotaged my files.
Since their transformation, however, they've become much more loyal.
Sounds like a temporary fix. The Emperor prefers me to employ more permanent solutions.
Traitors deserve only death.
Perhaps you need a new master. One with more vision.
You transformed your assistants into rakghoul slaves? Nice. You ever thought about coming to work for the Empire?
I like your style.
Oh, I could make you a similar offer.
Remind me to say "no" if you ever try to hire me.
Glad I don't work for you.
My offer might be more enticing than you think.
I guess that's more efficient than throwing resources away.
Monstrously practical.
I run a small operation. By necessity, I've become quite resourceful.
You really think they'll stay loyal after you turned them into monsters?
They'll turn on you.
Should I be surprised the Empire expects treachery around every corner? My children are loyal; it's part of the transformation!
I've already taken out about a hundred of your "children." What's a few more?
So I'll kill them, too.
The rakghouls you faced in my lab were nothing compared to these!
I've found a way to evolve the virus. Each new strain makes the host more powerful than the last.
That power can be yours. Let me inject you with the virus, and you will become greater than you ever dreamed!
Nice try. The virus takes away the subject's free will. You said so yourself.
And I'll be your slave.
Not the latest version. It causes a physical transformation, but leaves the mind untouched. I indulged just before you arrived!
If the latest version of the virus is so great, why don't you inject yourself?
You first.
I did--just before you arrived! The newest version brings about a physical transformation, but leaves the mental faculties untouched.
Did you really think I would share my creation with the Empire? Fools! I've only been stalling for time!
I'm tired of listening to your insane ranting.
My patience is wearing thin.
I was simply stalling for time. I injected myself with the latest version of the virus just before you arrived!
This strain brings about the physical transformation, but leaves the mind untouched.
Ahh!
Gaze upon the pinnacle of evolution with awe and terror! Weep for what you will never become!
